summary.overview: The application is a drag-and-drop shopping cart interface where users can drag items from a list and drop them into a designated area to add them to their cart. The application calculates and displays the total cost of the items in the cart.
summary.predefined_options: The application uses predefined product titles and prices for each item, which are displayed in a list format.
summary.external_resources: Images for each product are used as external resources, sourced from local paths such as 'img/img1.jpg', 'img/img2.jpg', etc.
summary.external_js_libraries: No external JavaScript libraries are explicitly mentioned in the provided code.

requirements.description: When the page loads, the user can see a list of products, each with an image, title, and price.
The user can drag a product item from the list by clicking and holding the mouse button on the item.
The user can drop a dragged product item into the designated drop area (shopping cart) by releasing the mouse button over the area.
Upon dropping a product into the shopping cart, the system adds the product to the cart and displays the product title, quantity, and price in the cart area.
If the user drops the same product into the cart multiple times, the system increments the quantity of that product in the cart.
The system calculates the total cost of all products in the cart and displays it at the bottom of the cart area, formatted with the appropriate currency symbol and two decimal places.
The user can see the total cost update in real-time as they add more products to the cart.
